attributes.comment:
While I understand the rational for raising the fees, since the last
comprehensive fee review was in 1998, I believe this fee unfairly discriminates
against parents filing I-600's to adopt children from the People's Republic of
China.

We suggest the Department of Homeland Security increase the length of time that
the I-171 remains valid. Right now, there is a discrepancy between adoption
times (which have increased dramatically in the last several years) and the
period of time the I-171 remains valid. Due to this discrepancy, right now
parents adopting from the PRC will have to file the I-600 **TWICE**, and
therefore the current proposed fee increase appears, to me, onerous.

A change in fee, if implemented, should be accompanied by an equivalent increase
in the duration the I-171/I-600 remains valid.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Caroline C. Evascu
